org.arl.fjage.connectors

Class PseudoOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • org.arl.fjage.connectors.PseudoOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class PseudoOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream
    An output stream backed by a byte buffer that can be read from.

      • read

        public int read()
        Read a byte from the stream buffer. Blocks if none available.
        Returns:
        byte read, or -1 on error (if stream is closed or interrupt).

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buf)
        Read a byte buffer from the stream buffer. Blocks if no data available. May return less data than the buffer size.
        Returns:
        number of bytes read, or -1 on error (if stream is closed or interrupt).

      • readAvailable

        public byte[] readAvailable()
        Reads all available data from the stream buffer. Blocks if no data available.
        Returns:
        bytes array on success, null on failure (if stream is closed or interrupt).

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
        Reads a line of text from the stream buffer. Blocks if no data available.
        Returns:
        text string on success, null on failure (if stream is closed or interrupt).

      • available

        public int available()
        Get the number of bytes available in stream to read.
        Returns:
        number of bytes available, -1 on error (if stream is closed).
